decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Adopted UDP Policies B1, B5, ES6 and B24, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 4.8. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted UDP Policies H33 and B5, Replacement UDP Policies 5.5 and 4.1. | The insertion of windows with both vertical and horizontal glazing bars as per approved drawing SK03E shall be implemented and permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interests of the appearance and character of the locality, which is a designated conservation area, and in accordance with Adopted UDP Policy B24, Replacement UDP Policy 4.8. | The base of the proposed dormers shall be sited 0.45m from the roof eaves line as indicated on drawing No. SK-03E.  REASON:  In the interests of the appearance and character of the locality which is a designated conservation area, and in accordance with Adopted UDP Policies B1, B5, ES6 and B24, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 4.8.
description: Removal of existing dormer extension; erection of three dormer extensions in rear roofslope of second floor level flat
